Returns:
StationGraph* If available, the station graph represented by ID.

bool StationGraph::isReady (  )  const

This method returns whether or not the station graph is ready for use.

It will be true once the first chunk item node is loaded. This is because without a chunk item, the real world positions of the nodes in the graph are not known, and also because graphs need to be loaded via the chunk loading thread and not directly by script or main thread code.

const UniqueID & StationGraph::name (  )  const

This method returns the unique id of the graph.

const UniqueID& The id of the graph.

This method returns the nearest node to the given world position.

Parameters:
worldPos The query position.
Returns:
The id of the nearest node. The id will be zero if there isn't a nearest node.

void StationGraph::registerNode ( ChunkStationNode *  node,
Chunk *  pChunk 
)

This method registers a node with a graph.

It keeps the internal Nodes in sync with the ChunkStationNodes of the graph.

Parameters:
node The node to register.
pChunk The chunk that the node is in.

bool StationGraph::worldPosition ( const UniqueID &  src,
Vector3 &  retWorldPos 
)

This method returns the world position of the given node.

The resultant world position is returned in the passed in retWorldPos Vector3 reference.

Parameters:
src ID of the node.
retWorldPos Returned Vector3 containing the world position.
Returns:
bool Whether or not retWorldPos has been set.
